HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: limit of body is skin, limit of “lived-body” more difficult to determine, not “world” > only world where there’s language, i.e. understanding of being

HDG.FS.content: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

HDG.FS.content: how same expression can move from metaphysical to non-metaphysical language: 1) inner illumination (innere Erleuchtung), being itself announces itself (sich bekundet), that Dasein unfolds (ausbildet) ein “Seinsverständnis,” Seinsfrage in Sein und Zeit calls for a renewal (Erneuerung) of language 2) favorable external conditions: a) decline (Verfall) and impoverishment (Verarmung) of language [compare to rich language of brothers Grimm] b) fixing of language in computer calculation stops its natural growth

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: computer language makes visible end of language/tradition: surge of information veils disappearance [oblivion of oblivion] of what has been > prospective planning (Vorausplanung): obstruction (Absperren) of future

HDG.FS.content: experience of instancy in clearing of Being, only possible through detour (Umweg) of return to beginning > return occurs in echo of Parmenides, the hearing that opens in our present age (epoch of sending [Schickung] of being as Ge-stell)

HDG.MA.content: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

HDG.CCP.content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

Introduction to Metaphysics…stand in contradiction (p.82?)] is waiting > we presage (ahnen) [cf. Basic Concepts] the nature of thinking as releasement (only to forget Gelassenheit again) > thinking isn’t self-subsisting releasement: it’s the regioning of releasement, releasing releasement into Gegnet

HDG.DL.content: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: we’re all clumsy questioners (unbehlofener Frager) [following unwritten prescription (ungeschriebenen Vorschrift)], despite much care, keep overlooking essentials [arrival?] > we notice quite late our carelessness re: words, because language is more powerful/weightier than we are

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

HDG.DL.content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

HDG.WL.content: [method] speak about speech qua speech (Die Sprache als die Sprache zur Sprache bringen): each Sprache says something different yet the Same > this Same, the oneness that’s the distinctive property of language, holds together (zueinanderhält) what is kept separate (Auseinandergehaltene)

HDG.WL.content: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]

HDG.WL.content: a web compresses, obstructs the straight clear view (gerade Durchsicht) in its mesh (Verflochtenen) [condensation] > we can’t disregard web of language, what seems its hopeless tangle > attempt to loosen the web to view the “open togetherness (freie Zusammengehören) of the relations named in the formula”: try to experience unbinding bond (entbindende Band) in web of language

HDG.WL.content: the web of language is often considered circular, language determines the circle itself, might experience this movement by entering the web
HDG.WL.linkedContent: the web of language is often considered circular, language determines the circle itself, might experience this movement by entering the web

HDG.WL.content: the more language shows (zeigt) its own character (Eigenen), more significant (bedeutsamer) the way to language becomes for language itself, our formula [p. 112] becomes a soundless echo (lautloser Anklang), letting us hear something (ein Geringes) of proper character (Eigentümlichen) of language
HDG.WL.linkedContent: the more language shows (zeigt) its own character (Eigenen), more significant (bedeutsamer) the way to language becomes for language itself, our formula [p. 112] becomes a soundless echo (lautloser Anklang), letting us hear something (ein Geringes) of proper character (Eigentümlichen) of language

HDG.WL.content: speech, not a secure possession (kein fester Besitz) > in shock, a man may be silent; in an accident, a man becomes mute (not silent) > language manifests itself in speaking (Die Sprache zeigt sich im Sprechen) as activation of organs of speech (mouth, lips, teeth, tongue, larynx)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: speech, not a secure possession (kein fester Besitz) > in shock, a man may be silent; in an accident, a man becomes mute (not silent) > language manifests itself in speaking (Die Sprache zeigt sich im Sprechen) as activation of organs of speech (mouth, lips, teeth, tongue, larynx)

HDG.WL.content: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth
HDG.WL.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth

HDG.WL.content: since the Greeks, beings (Seiende) experienced as what is present (Anwesende) > since language is, the speaking that occurs belongs to what is present [phono-logocentrism]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: since the Greeks, beings (Seiende) experienced as what is present (Anwesende) > since language is, the speaking that occurs belongs to what is present [phono-logocentrism]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: language an activity (energeia), continual intellectual effort (Arbeit des Geistes) to make articulated sound capable of expressing thought—only totality of this speaking can be regarded as language [i.e. the thought & the articulation?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt: language an activity (energeia), continual intellectual effort (Arbeit des Geistes) to make articulated sound capable of expressing thought—only totality of this speaking can be regarded as language [i.e. the thought & the articulation?]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

HDG.WL.content: to reflect on language qua language, abandon traditional procedure, no longer look for general notions (Vorstellungen) (energy, activity, labor, power of spirit, world view, expression) > explaining language by way of something else, running away (wegzuflüchten) from it > “the way to language intends to let language be experienced as language”
HDG.WL.linkedContent: to reflect on language qua language, abandon traditional procedure, no longer look for general notions (Vorstellungen) (energy, activity, labor, power of spirit, world view, expression) > explaining language by way of something else, running away (wegzuflüchten) from it > “the way to language intends to let language be experienced as language”

HDG.WL.content: attend (Achten) to language exclusively as language, follow language’s demands, focus our eyes on that which gathers, grants (gewährt), proper unity of essence of language
HDG.WL.linkedContent: attend (Achten) to language exclusively as language, follow language’s demands, focus our eyes on that which gathers, grants (gewährt), proper unity of essence of language

HDG.WL.content: way to language: approach more closely language’s own peculiar character (dem Eigentümlichen der Sprache näherzukommen) > here too language shows itself as our way of speaking: attend only to those things, noticed (beachtet) or not, that join/have voice (mitspricht) in language
HDG.WL.linkedContent: way to language: approach more closely language’s own peculiar character (dem Eigentümlichen der Sprache näherzukommen) > here too language shows itself as our way of speaking: attend only to those things, noticed (beachtet) or not, that join/have voice (mitspricht) in language

HDG.WL.content: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name
HDG.WL.linkedContent: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

HDG.WL.content: Aufriss of language will remain veiled if we don’t properly attend (eigens beachten) to spoken/unspoken [so we can arrive beyond the veil?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Aufriss of language will remain veiled if we don’t properly attend (eigens beachten) to spoken/unspoken [so we can arrive beyond the veil?]

HDG.WL.content: phonetic-acoustic-physiological explanation of sounds (Lautung) of language doesn’t experience their origin in ringing stillness (Geläut der Stille)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: phonetic-acoustic-physiological explanation of sounds (Lautung) of language doesn’t experience their origin in ringing stillness (Geläut der Stille)

HDG.WL.content: simultaneousness (Zugleich) of speaking/listening: speaking is of itself listening, listening to language we speak, listening not while (zugleich) but before (zuvor) we are speaking
HDG.WL.linkedContent: simultaneousness (Zugleich) of speaking/listening: speaking is of itself listening, listening to language we speak, listening not while (zugleich) but before (zuvor) we are speaking

HDG.WL.content: we speak by way (aus) of language [rather than, we speak the language], we can because we have already listened to it
HDG.WL.linkedContent: we speak by way (aus) of language [rather than, we speak the language], we can because we have already listened to it

HDG.WL.content: even w/out organs, language speaks (Sprache spricht) > language speaks by saying, i.e. showing > this is how language speaks: language as showing, reaches into all regions of presences (Anwesens), summoning what is present (Anwesendes) to appear & fade > what language says (Sagen) wells up (entquillt) from what has been said and the still remaining unsaid Sage, which pervades (durchzieht) the Aufriss des Sprachwesens
HDG.WL.linkedContent: even w/out organs, language speaks (Sprache spricht) > language speaks by saying, i.e. showing > this is how language speaks: language as showing, reaches into all regions of presences (Anwesens), summoning what is present (Anwesendes) to appear & fade > what language says (Sagen) wells up (entquillt) from what has been said and the still remaining unsaid Sage, which pervades (durchzieht) the Aufriss des Sprachwesens

HDG.WL.content: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant
HDG.WL.linkedContent: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant

HDG.WL.content: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

HDG.WL.content: let us again attend (achten) to the way of language [summary of path thus far, via Humboldt, etc.]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: let us again attend (achten) to the way of language [summary of path thus far, via Humboldt, etc.]

HDG.WL.content: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

HDG.WL.content: a way (Weg): allows us to reach something (lässt gelangen) [arrival] > peculiarity (Eigentümliche) of language conceals itself > that we are allowed to listen, we belong to language, this belonging contains actual presence (eigentlich Wesende) of way to language [proximity to facticity of language] > essence of Saying will only make itself manifest (bekunden) if we attend (achten) w/ great instancy to what the foregoing Erläuterung has offered
HDG.WL.linkedContent: a way (Weg): allows us to reach something (lässt gelangen) [arrival] > peculiarity (Eigentümliche) of language conceals itself > that we are allowed to listen, we belong to language, this belonging contains actual presence (eigentlich Wesende) of way to language [proximity to facticity of language] > essence of Saying will only make itself manifest (bekunden) if we attend (achten) w/ great instancy to what the foregoing Erläuterung has offered

HDG.WL.content: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend
HDG.WL.linkedContent: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend

HDG.WL.content: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

HDG.WL.content: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]

HDG.WL.content: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]

HDG.WL.content: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively

HDG.WL.content: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective
HDG.WL.linkedContent: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.WL.content: man can never step out of language & look at it from somewhere else, only see its nature to the extent it has appropriated us to itself > that we cannot know the nature of language is an advantage (Vorzug), we’re favored w/in a special realm (ausgezeichneten Bereich), where we are needed/used (Gebrauchten) by language, where we dwell as mortals
HDG.WL.linkedContent: man can never step out of language & look at it from somewhere else, only see its nature to the extent it has appropriated us to itself > that we cannot know the nature of language is an advantage (Vorzug), we’re favored w/in a special realm (ausgezeichneten Bereich), where we are needed/used (Gebrauchten) by language, where we dwell as mortals

HDG.WL.content: Language has been called “the house of Being (Haus des Seins)”: it is the keeper (Hut) of being present (Anwesens)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Language has been called “the house of Being (Haus des Seins)”: it is the keeper (Hut) of being present (Anwesens)

HDG.WL.content: to pursue Sprachwesen in thought, a change of Sprache is necessary that we can’t compel/invent, can’t just procure new words/phrases > concerns our relation to language, which is determined by destiny [how will language retain us in Ereignis?] : our Saying (always an answering) forever relational
HDG.WL.linkedContent: to pursue Sprachwesen in thought, a change of Sprache is necessary that we can’t compel/invent, can’t just procure new words/phrases > concerns our relation to language, which is determined by destiny [how will language retain us in Ereignis?] : our Saying (always an answering) forever relational

HDG.WL.content: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.EC.content: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

HDG.EC.content: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death

HDG.EC.content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

HDG.EC.content: devastation concerns our own essence in a way we’re just beginning to presage (ahnen) [proximity to presupposition]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: devastation concerns our own essence in a way we’re just beginning to presage (ahnen) [proximity to presupposition]

HDG.EC.content: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death

HDG.EC.content: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting
HDG.EC.linkedContent: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

HDG.EC.content: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful
HDG.EC.linkedContent: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful

HDG.EC.content: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]

HDG.EC.content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

HDG.EC.content: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming

HDG.EC.content: waiting as authentic thinking? entering still-withheld essence of our [why our?] vanquished people > by becoming those who wait, we 1st become German? [become German, but not like Nazis… (cf. 154)] if we plan to find “the German” we simply chase after the national: nation as representation, so people become a subject, so that everything appears objective

[become German, but not like Nazis… (cf. 154)] if we plan to find “the German” we simply chase after the national: nation as representation, so people become a subject, so that everything appears objective

HDG.OHF.content: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials

HDG.OHF.content: a concept points to a forehaving/foreconception (Vorgriff), transports us to a fundamental experience, calls for a how of addressing (Ansprechens)/interrogating: transports (versetzt) us into the being-there of our Dasein (interpretation & worry [Bekümerung]) > fundamental concepts (Grundbegriffe) not later additions to Dasein, sondern vor-tragen (but carry forward, ex-press), grab/point Dasein in their way [auto-affection?]

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]

HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

HDG.OHF.content: feature of our awhileness (Jeweiligkeit) is the today (Heute), tarrying for a while in the present, in each case our own present (das Je-Verweilen in Gegenwart, der je eigenen)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: feature of our awhileness (Jeweiligkeit) is the today (Heute), tarrying for a while in the present, in each case our own present (das Je-Verweilen in Gegenwart, der je eigenen)

HDG.OHF.content: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]

HDG.OHF.content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

HDG.OHF.content: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time

HDG.OHF.content: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: to understand phenomenal context of significance: must see that its disclosedness stands in respective kind of care that tarries for awhile at a particular time (die Erschlossenheit in der jeweiligen Sorge steht): der Verweisungszusammenhang selbst ist das Besorgte > context of references is the environs in the authentic sense (eigentlich Umhafte), caring as a going around (Umgehen), going-here-and-there [cf. TEXT in Derrida] > significance (ontologically defined): the with-which of dealings (Umgang) with which our being cares

HDG.OHF.content: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
